result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy A Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment, and/or counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

-Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling. 
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy A Thomas

defendant.name: Thomas, Randy A
defendant.address: W333 N6472 Road L, Oconomowoc, WI 53066

records.addlTxt:
2:37 PM Defendant Randy A Thomas in court.  Attorney Bradley W Novreske in court for Randy A Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
State is ready to proceed to sentencing. 
Atty Novreske requests a new sentencing date and states reasons on the record. 
State has no objection to the request for a new sentencing date. 
Court denies an adjournment. 
State gives sentencing recommendation. 
Defense gives sentencing recommendation. 

Court orders the following:
Count 1
WITHHELD

TERM OF PROBATION: 3 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
 AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
 Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
 No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
 No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $ 268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Plea/Preliminary hearing held on July 21, 2022 filed by Court Reporter Mary Heederik
Notice of Completion of Representation filed by Atty. Angela Wang.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Angela Wang has bee appointed to represent the defendant.
Sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:50 AM Defendant Randy A Thomas in court with attorney Bradley W Novreske.  Atty Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
State is ready to proceed to trial.  
Parties have had further negotiations. 
Defense requests 30 days to be able to pay the buy money. 
Court will leave trial on, court will take a plea and the trial may be removed. 
Court is in recess in this matter. 

Matter recalled at 11:26 am  Same appearances. 
Defense would like to enter a plea today. 
Court conducts colloquy with defendant and goes over waiver of right to preliminary hearing on the record. 
  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.
  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
State files information. 
Defense accepts information and waives reading.
Defense enters a plea of not guilty. 

Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of no contest to count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 

Defense requests a sentencing hearing date. 
State does not object. 
  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.

02:28 PM Defendant Randy A Thomas in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant states he went to the Public Defender's Office today and they indicated they would be assigning the same attorney to this case that is currently representing him on his other matter.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;

10:29 AM Defendant Randy A Thomas in court.  Atty Breski as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court sets bail on this matter. 
Court will set status of counsel in this matter.   Defendant to see if he qualifies for the public defender on this matter. 
  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
